programme.desc: Rose feels inadequate when her new boyfriend experiences impotency.

programme.desc: Sophia disapproves of the man Dorothy is dating; Blanche and Rose befriend juvenile delinquents.

programme.desc: Dorothy takes Sophia to Disney World for quality time; Rose and Blanche write a children's book.

programme.desc: Rose finally gets to confront her fantasy that Bob Hope is her father.

programme.desc: Sophia invests her roommates' money in a prizefighter named "Kid Pepe" who is a gifted violinist.

programme.title: Gilmore Girls

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Rory runs into Dean and his new girlfriend at a hockey game; Lorelai finds fault with Jess' treatment of her daughter; Emily is shocked to find her mother-in-law (Marion Ross) kissing a man.

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Rory waits for acceptance letters from colleges; Lorelai shares a passionate kiss with ex-fiance Max and wonders if ending the engagement was the right decision.

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Lorelai must find rooms for the guests at the Independence Inn when a fire breaks out during a meeting of the Edgar Allen Poe Society.

programme.desc: When Brock takes the children to Barbra Jean's family reunion, Reba contemplates having sex with her new boyfriend.

programme.desc: Reba invites her beau home to meet the family; Brock and the children attend Barbra Jean's family reunion in Fisheye Bottom.

programme.title: The Golden Girls
programme.desc: Dorothy and Blanche try to help Rose overcome a 30-year dependency on prescription medication.

programme.title: The Golden Girls
programme.desc: Rose thinks her visiting sister is trying to steal her friends.

programme.title: The Golden Girls
programme.desc: Sophia and Rose help a friend escape from an inadequate nursing home.

programme.desc: Sophia learns that the hospital may have switched Dorothy at birth with another baby.

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Rory and Dean fall asleep together following a fairytale evening at a formal dance, leading to a blowout between Lorelai and her mother over discipline.

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Lorelai is hurt when she is excluded from her parents' Christmas bash, but she rushes to the hospital after her father collapses at the party.

programme.title: You're Bacon Me Crazy
programme.desc: Cleo Morelli, an aspiring Portland chef, tries to win a food truck competition. When a handsome chef from a rival food truck parks across the street from her, Cleo's goal to win takes a spicy turn.

programme.title: Love of the Irish
programme.desc: Tired of bad luck, Fiona takes her mother on a trip to Ireland to turn things around. She soon meets a charming single father who helps her make her own luck.

programme.title: Savoring Paris
programme.desc: Disillusioned with her life, Ella embarks on a soul-searching journey to Paris, navigating love, self-discovery and cheese amid the city's enchanting backdrop.

programme.title: The Royal We
programme.desc: When her older sister elopes with a non-royal, Princess Bea, who has lived her life away from her royal duties, must step in and honor the arranged marriage to a small kingdom prince.

programme.title: The Heiress and the Handyman
programme.desc: After losing her fortune, an heiress moves to a rural farm where she mistakes her handsome neighbor for the handyman. To live up to her family's legacy, he helps her compete.

programme.title: The Groomsmen Second Chances
programme.desc: Danny finds the courage to admit his romantic feelings for his best friend, when he is asked to be the best man at his wedding in Greece.

programme.title: Catch of the Day
programme.desc: On the eve of becoming a New York executive chef, Sophie returns home to help her family's flailing restaurant and runs into Cam, an old crush who makes her question everything.

programme.desc: Blanche's plans to marry go awry when she discovers her fiance is a bigamist.

programme.desc: Rose tries to conceal the fact that she is dating Dr. Jonathan Newman, a little person.

programme.desc: Rose makes a mistake when she allows her boyfriend to spend the night with her.

programme.desc: Blanche, Dorothy and Rose vie for a charity award while fighting the flu.

programme.desc: Dorothy, Rose and Blanche reminisce about how they all came to live together.

programme.desc: Blanche fears she may be pregnant, but is actually going through menopause.

programme.desc: The girls move into a Miami Beach hotel; they dress up to attend Burt Reynolds' movie premiere, only to be caught in a hotel raid, mistaken for prostitutes and dragged off to jail.

programme.desc: A neighbor dies shortly after having a heated argument with Rose.

programme.desc: Sophia's new friend, an elderly gentleman, has Alzheimer's disease.

programme.desc: Blanche and Rose despise one of Dorothy's friends, the novelist Barbara Thorndyke.

programme.desc: The girls sit around, eat cheesecake, and remember terrible Valentine's Day experiences.

programme.desc: Dorothy and her former tennis rival play practical jokes during a reunion.

programme.desc: Harry Weston recommends a specialist who diagnoses Dorothy's illness.

programme.desc: Sophia faces a moral dilemma when an ill friend asks for help in ending her life.

programme.desc: Rose must test for AIDS following the revelation that she may have received a tainted transfusion.

programme.desc: An FBI agent investigates the girls ahead of a possible visit from President Bush, which leads them to reminisce about their experiences together.

programme.desc: Blanche dreams of a visit from her deceased husband; Dorothy finds herself in a love triangle while looking to meet her ideal man.

programme.desc: Rose auditions for a TV reporter job; Blanche seeks a commitment from a lukewarm beau.

programme.desc: Dorothy replaces Blanche as the center of attention for the men at Blanche's favorite nightspot.
